text: hi everyone, I'm new here, hope you are doing good. I have one question, i would like to add some responsive custom css to my drag and drop email template or my custom modules, but can't figure out how to do it, is there a workaround to achive this ? Thanks a lot in advance
Hey Denis, unfortunately this is not possible on the current version of the tool. :confused: For anything more complicated/responsive, I strongly suggest using the coded email templates.
Thank you for your feedback, but when i will use coded email templates, we can have de drag and drop features ?
Coded emails don't have drop and drop. Do you want the ease of drag and drop or the customization of coded? You basically have to choose one or the other.

I want to give the possibility to my client to use my template and drag and drop, remove, add modules, and in that template i would like to add custom css for mobile display, but don't think this is possible atm

There are ways to make a custom coded template that a client can use without touching code, but it won't be drag and drop. You can use a module with a repeater for X number of sections, and then they can choose the type of layout they would want for each section, and fill out the content. Because it's using a repeater they can re-order the sections, but they won't be dragging and dropping content blocks/elements into the email. You'd need to build in the flexibility to show/hide elements, etc. in the module.
